http.title: Site Not Configured | 404 Not Found
http.html:
404

The site you were looking for couldn't be found.

This domain is successfully pointed at WP Engine, but is not configured for an account on our platform.

  • If you just signed up, we're still likely creating your account.
  • Did you add this domain to your install?
  • Did you point DNS to the correct IP address or CNAME?
If you've completed the steps above, or need more help, please contact us and we can help get your site up and running in no time.

Hosted by

http.title: Home Craft Days | A Celebration of Appalachian Heritage
http.html:
October 18-20, 2019

Home Craft Days
  • Home
  • About
  • Photos
  • Crafts
  • Music
  • Culture
  • Shop
  • Parking
  • Map
  • Vendors

Festival Schedule

Friday, October 18:  Free Concert 6 p.m. to 9 p.m., Goodloe Center at MECC Campus.  Food Vendor booths are open (optional).

Saturday, October 19 & Sunday, October 20: Vendors open from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

 

NEW FOR 2019

Coming soon!

2019 LINEUP COMING SOON

Music begins Friday night in the Goodloe Center and continues under the tent for the weekend. With 30+ Homegrown, Regional & National Acts Performing, this may just be the best musical lineup yet!

Volunteers Needed

Click here to sign up to volunteer at this year’s event!

Craft Vendor Info

Are you interested in being a vendor at Home Craft Days? Check out this page for info on how to become a vendor-partner for this year’s festival.

  • Watch The Video

  • 6 months ago

    In our families and communities, there are folks who are the keepers of family and local history. They save our stories and past them down to the next generation. On Saturday, October 20, 2018, Bill Best, author of Saving Seeds, Preserving Taste: Heirloom Seed Savers in Appalachia will give two presentations on heirloom seed saving at Home Craft Days. Meet Bill Best, retired professor of Berea College, author, farmer, and the keeper of heirloom seeds... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UD_cTXA9edc ... See more

    Meet a remarkable farmer and author who's lifelong work in seed preservation will open your eyes to the benefits of heirloom seeds and their effect on the qu...

    View on facebook
    6 months ago

    Bill Best, seed saver from Berea, Kentucky will give two presentations on saving heirloom seeds at Home Craft Days on Saturday, October 20, 2018 at 2 PM and again at 3 PM in Godwin Hall, Room 155. For more on Bill Best, see http://www.kentuckyartisancenter.ky.gov/ArtisanDetail.aspx?artisanId=8970 ... See more

    Bill Best has catalogued 175 to 200 varieties of old-time beans and numerous heirloom varieties of tomatoes, for preservation and growing on his farm located outside of Berea, Kentucky. Bill Best grows and sells seeds, plants, and his yearly harvest of beans and tomatoes at the Lexington and Berea F... ... See more

    View on facebook
